pr_title: Move static fields and methods from MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper

timeline.message:
Add MethodHandleHelper which includes static methods from OpenJ9 MethodHandle

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update native dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper

The names of the following Java native methods are updated in native
code since they are moved from the MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper
class:
- getCPTypeAt
- getCPMethodTypeAt
- getCPMethodHandleAt
- getCPClassNameAt
- getCPConstantDynamicAt

The names of the following Java methods, which are invoked from native
code, are updated since they are moved from the MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper class:
- sendResolveMethodHandle
- resolveInvokeDynamic
- resolveConstantDynamic
- constructorPlaceHolder

The above MethodHandleHelper Java methods will be used in both OpenJ9
and OpenJDK JSR292 implementations.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: There are a lot of xxxxPlaceHolder methods.  Why is only this one being moved?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1521,19 +1052,6 @@ private MethodHandle filterArgumentsPlaceHolder(int index, int parentOffset, int
 		return this;
 	}
 	
-	/*[IF ]*/
-	/*
-	 * Used to preserve the new objectRef on the stack when avoiding the call-in for
-	 * constructorHandles.  Must return 'this' so stackmapper will keep the object
-	 * alive.
-	 */
-	/*[ENDIF]*/
-	@SuppressWarnings("unused")
-	@VMCONSTANTPOOL_METHOD
-	private static Object constructorPlaceHolder(Object newObjectRef) {

replies.bodyText: Other xxxxPlaceHolder methods are non-static. Similar JCL init issues were not seen with non-static MH methods. So, only the static MH.constructorPlaceHolder is being moved.
replies.author: babsingh

replies.bodyText: in this PR please.  We'll rerun tests as required - likely only a single platform
replies.author: DanHeidinga

timeline.message:
Move static fields and methods from MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper

The code has been verbatim moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper.

The following static final fields are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- UNSAFE
- JITHELPERS
- BSM_ARGUMENT_SIZE
- BSM_ARGUMENT_COUNT_OFFSET
- BSM_ARGUMENTS_OFFSET
- BSM_LOOKUP_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_NAME_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_TYPE_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_OPTIONAL_ARGUMENTS_START_INDEX

The following native static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- getCPTypeAt
- getCPMethodTypeAt
- getCPMethodHandleAt
- getCPClassNameAt
- getCPConstantDynamicAt

The following Java static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- resolveConstantDynamic
- constructorPlaceHolder
- invokeBsm
- resolveInvokeDynamic
- sendResolveMethodHandle
- resolveFieldHandleHelper
- getClassFromJ9Class
- fromFieldDescriptorString
- getAdditionalBsmArg
- throwNoClassDefFoundError
- getJ9ClassFromClass

This is done to support the OpenJDK MethodHandle class. Some of the
above Java static methods will be updated to support the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class.

This will also resolve a limitation of vmconstantpool.xml, which exposes
some of the above Java static methods in the native code. The OpenJDK
MethodHandle class does not have the above Java static methods. Having
the static methods in MethodHandleHelper allows them to be exposed to
both OpenJ9 and OpenJDK implementations. This prevents the JCL
initialization crash, associated to vmconstantpool.xml, when the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class is enabled.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update Java dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper static fields/methods

Previously, the MethodHandle class contained UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass. Since these items have been moved from the
MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper class, the associated Java
dependencies have been updated to use UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass from the MethodHandleHelper class.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

and OpenJDK JSR292 implementations.
